content: Fantastic educational tool ...Familiarize yourself with the full functionality of this seemingly simplistic app. Everything from notes to intervals, chord construction, and the flexibility to construct your own scales or arpeggios.
Love it!
While I hate the color palette, and think the interface could be made much more appealing, the fact is that this is hands down the best guitar scales app I have come across.
Just bought the app. Had the free version which I uninstalled. Wants to charge me again to load paid version on to my phone. Please advise.
It's too cheap for the awesome features. Keep up the good works! Thanks!
Good
Great app, definitely worth buying the full version.

Simple to use app. Not only is it an easy way to reference scales, but the ability to tap the screen and play notes makes it a great app to work out melodies. I would have paid more for this useful tool. The free version is already well worth the download, but the price of the paid version is a real bargain.
It changed the way I practice guitar..
Excellant program! Spend the small price. You'll be happy you did.
Perfect reference for creating practice sessions easily.
Fantastic resource for learning and practicing scales - I use it every day. It's invaluable and well worth the small price. Thank you.
Excellent.

This app is pretty great. The only thing that I would like to see is a feature that will play a scales audio so you can play along with it and be able to adjust the tempo so you can start slow and speed it up as you progress. :-)
Awesome and simple reference app. Only improvement I might ask of is having more tunings, and/or being able to save your custom tunings.
replyContent:
hey, thanks for the feedback.
i already have this feature as a "todo" for a future update. 
regards

content: This is a very good tool

Great app with a wide selection of great scales and excellent customization. My only reason for a star deduction is that as a bass player who uses drop tuning, I'm unable to access the C#1 I need. E1 is the lowest this app will go... So for bass players and extended range guitarists, you'll be limited in this app.
replyContent:
hi, 
you can change the tuning in the Properties for each string. The lowest note is B0, so definitely C#1 is available.
Vlad

content: Awesome app. Problem is I paid for it on my other phone but can't update it on my other phone with the same Google account
replyContent:
hello, you should be able to update it on all devices with Android 5+ . Maybe this second phone has some older version of Android?
Maybe you can try to uninstall the free version from that device - and install directly the full app?

content: Very good app for learning scales , what would make for a good addition is to be able to overlock the major and minor scales together for practice.

This app is really well thought out and useful. My only wish is that you could display 12 frets without scrolling. This would make it easier to work out scale runs. Also the blue note on the blues scales would be nice in a different colour. Apart from that - superb! :)

Pretty good app, except every time I try to change to a different mode I get a message asking me to buy the pro version which is what I am in, I've already paid for it. I can get to the new mode by getting out of the app which takes me to the Google Play screen and if I click 'open' and go back to the app it does open the nee mode but all of this is a real pain.
replyContent:
Hello, 
you probably have both apps installed - the free and the full one. The full app has a pinkish icon - you should open.
You can also uninstall the free app - the one with the blue icon.

content: Really good app with no ads or pop ups. Does what it is meant to do. Would be great if could choose electric guitar instead of the nylon string guitar

I did use this app for a while. But today I decided to purchase full version, and I am fully satisfied. The app provides so many patterns and scales in different styles which make learning more easy and effective. Thank you Vladimir for your job, well done. 5 stars.
Awesome

Very useful info with an effective and clean UI. The free version was great and I was happy to pay for the additional content. Slight issue when I paid, but it was fixed literally within minutes through email. Good program, great service.
Very usefull and it has everything I need to know about scales.
Excellent app and ... Great graphic design and well thought out, really useful to me in so many ways, I love it and it'll be getting plenty of use! Thank you!!!

Updating review to 5 stars. After receiving refund, I heard back from developer that the crashing issue was fixed in next update. So just repurchased again this morning and updated it and now app runs well. I like how clean and simple UI is! Makes exploring scales easy! One feature request: would be great to be able to display other notes on the strings that are not part of current scale (maybe in non-highlighted format), and also allow you to play those notes as well.
replyContent:
hi, 
in the 1.54 version - the "outside notes" feature is available as an option in Properties. Cheers.
Vlad

content: Outstanding. Also a 320bpm metronome.
i hope u add electric guitar distortion voice.
Vladimir, is there any way we can play more than one note at a time? Trying to form chords out of the scales would be a very nice addition. Thank You!
I need a 7 string drop A scale and this app make me happy and bang
Great app. Has everything you would need to know about any scale in any key. Also shows triad notes.
Thank you Vladimir for this great app
I wanted to give five stars but there are problems with the metronome lagging and skipping beats. The rest of the app works perfectly but the metronome needs work.
Best scales app so far

I love this app, but I give only 4 stars due the fretboard is only 22 frets and no 24 frets, also it would be very nice if you gave an option to highlight more than one box at the same time (e.g. hightlight frets 8-11 and 14-17). Like I repeat, it's a great app and I love it.
replyContent: Thanks for the review. The latest version is actually 24 frets.

content: very good appa .we leran about

This is one of the best scale apps on play store, it's good for beginners but to break out of the box to free up the fretboard can you make options for Vertical and horizontal way and also the CAGED system and chords it will make it complete and you wouldn't want another app except this one. please can you add the notes names Do Re Mi Fa So La Si Do that would make it easier to Thanks
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. I guess these features could be added in the future versions

content: Awesome App. A must have for any level of Guitar experience. Thank you for having this app available for download !

Great app. Can notes be seen turned to you when in landscape mode ? Record feature would be nice for composing. Being a mode is the combination of 7 scales shifted on the neck, would like to see an option for allowing these boxed "shapes" to be shown, maybe a colored outline for each. Worth every penny.

Started with the free version and loved it enough to buy the full version, it's what i use to help learn while i'm at college. just found the feature that allows you to add a 7th string which is very handy since my primary guitar is a 7.
very good.
It is excellent, though I am a still a beginner, It helps me a lot when it comes to song writing, I especially like the "show triads option"
Pretty sweet. I now have a catalog featuring many scales, in every key, at the tips of my fingers. Totally worth the $5 or whatever it was.
We really could do with an apegio version or built in to the app. But if I could add more stars I would. Pro version purchased.

I truly enjoy this app. Its helped me a ton to nail down guitar solos. I particularly enjoyed the way that the various scales were previously organized because the major modes were together, the exotic scales were together, the pentatonic scales were together, etc. UPDATE: Organization of the of the Major modes was updated!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!
I found the app a little too complex for my own skills on the guitar, though I can see that this could be a very useful app.
Love the app is just great

There are no instructions, how are you supposed to use this? Beginner 
guitarist, not sure what to do.

For scalar reference on the go this is great. It's exactly what it says. 
Something I would like for it to have, is a list of chords usable within 
each scale. With the notes laid out I typically just construct the chords 
but it would help my band mates follow what I'm doing.
replyContent:
hi, thank you for the review.
When you click on the "?" buton it gives you the "main" triads available in the scale. You can also select a triad to be displayed

content:
Wonderful reference app!! This is a must have for any level of guitar 
player!!! This is an app that you can use whether a beginner to advanced 
guitarist!!
replyContent: hi, thanks for the feedback. yes i am thinking to add 3 note scales in a later update and probably the caged arpeggios

content: I am not a huge app buyer I really prefer the free apps. Which I tried the free version for about 10 minutes and this is probably one of the best applications for guitar scales i have ever seen. I purchased the full version after trying free for 10 minutes. Now as beginner you will do fine with free version. If you take guitar seriously or you know the basics to the major scales and want to expand your knowledge the full version is a great tool. You can see so many scales and the structure as well one of the buttons switches showing the note to where it is on the scale like flat 3rd flat 5th and so on. So much information  that will allow you to really dig into your guitar and music theory. This app is money well spent.

Great app. I have it open all the time when practicing. Accommodates non-standard tunings easily, in case you want to find eg triad inversions for Bb mixolydian in open D tuning. Fantastic tool with lots of depth and flexibility.
Excellent Scales App - The Latest Update is Great,  Thanks!

I don't normally write reviews for apps but this is awesome...its all you need to practice scales and even break down songs you can play. Pretty simple but for 2 bucks, hey why not. Better than viewing a website on my phone that doesn't fit the tabs or images properly on the screen. This apps got every note on your fretboard right at your fingertips within a specific scale of your choosing. Well done sir.
It is a good app. According to me, it would be great if it has Indian scales and ukelele scales, too.
replyContent:
hi, thanks for the suggestions. For Ukulele - you can open Properties, and create custom tuning for 4 strings, like GCEA.  The app will show the scales for the tuning. 
It will even try to calculate boxes (these may not be 100% covered though).  I may add this as predefined tuning soon :) Still, you can do it by yourself even now. Best regards

content: Vladamir- this is a wonderful app perhaps almost best in class. However it is missing one CRITICAL thing. There needs to be a way to change the note letter displayed to the numbered scale degrees: i.e. 1, 3b,5, 6,7b.  This is really important and would open the app up for serious music students and those studying Harmony. Is there any way way you can do this? Until then it does limit my ability to use it. Still otherwise nice app! (Jeff- Purchased copy user)
replyContent:
hey, 
actually the small "note" button in the right-bottom corner toggles that. If it is not what you are asking - please let me know
best regards!

content: Can you add tuner for guitar inside this app
Ok to learn new scales.
Excellent. Well thought out. Many thanks!
Looking forward to more scale
Delivers exactly what it promises. Looking forward to more scales.
Just what I wanted in a scale app. Worth paying for 😊
I never leave reviews ever, if you are looking for scales this is it. Scales upon scales and shows you the notes along with the patterns. Highly recommend

Best UI so far, lots of scales, very easy to learn to play, I'm new to guitar but also helps in music production. Surprisingly easy to come up with notes for a good melody and play on keyboard for example.  Thanks!
